articles.title: Exhibition of Landscape Painting, Embroideries and Handicrafts Opens
articles.content:
Exhibition of Landscape Painting, Embroideries and Handicrafts Opens
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of landscape paintings, embroideries and handicrafts was open at the Pyongyang International House of Culture on Friday to celebrate the 96th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Displayed in the center of the venue of the exhibition is a painting portraying Kim Jong Suk performing her duty as bodyguard for President Kim Il Sung in the period of building a new country just as she did during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 Also on display is oil painting "Saying I Have Come to See My Soldiers" depicting leader Kim Jong Il finding himself among service personnel of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Exhibited are at least 170 fine art works including Korean paintings, oil paintings, embroideries and handicrafts produced by artists across the country.
					
					 Oil painting "Jong Il Peak Seen from Saja Peak" and Korean painting "Pine Tree on Lagoon Samil" make visitors look back on the noble revolutionary life and feats of the woman commander of Mt. Paektu who remained most loyal to Kim Il Sung and brought a rosy future of Songun Korea.
					
					 Also displayed at the exhibition are Korean paintings "Brilliant Snowflakes" and "Happy Night", oil painting "Munsu Water Park under Loving Care" which represent the stirring reality of the DPRK where the noble desire of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu has come true thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Among those exhibits are Koryo celadon with a long-standing history and tradition, ceramic crafts and stoneworks.
					
					 Officials in the field of culture and art, artists, drawing lovers and other people and students in the city went round the exhibition.

articles.title: Delegation of Federation of Koreans in US Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Federation of Koreans in US Leaves
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. headed by Secretary General Kim Hyon Hwan left here by air on Saturday after taking part in the memorial service for commemorating the 2nd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Families Back Home
articles.content:
Chinese Families Back Home
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Families of Zhang Wei-hua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Bao-zhong, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, left here for home Saturday after participating in the memorial service for commemorating the second anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Wind Power in Effective Use
articles.content:
Wind Power in Effective Use
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Unchon County, South Hwanghae Province, the DPRK rose to fame throughout the country for making effective use of wind power to satisfy its needs for electricity.
					 Now, more than 2,000 wind power generators are whirling in the county.
					
					 This year alone, a work has been carried out to install one generator for each two dwelling houses in seven villages in Chongdae-ri of the county.
					
					 Some villages in the county witness almost 70 percent of their dwelling houses supplied with electricity from the generators.
					
					 The generators are manufactured on the basis of advanced technology at the farm machine station in the county and machinery repair shops in each co-op farms.
					
					 The installation of wind power generators is gaining momentum in Ryangdam-ri, Samsan-ri, Tokchon-ri and other areas of the county.
					
					 The county has steadily increased its dependence on wind power from Juche 84 (1995).

articles.title: Weekend Sports Games in DPRK
articles.content:
Weekend Sports Games in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Various sports games take place in each weekend in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 A men's soccer match was held between Ryongaksan and Hwaebul teams at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Friday. The former beat the latter 1:0 in the match. The two teams will have another match at the stadium on Sunday.
					
					 On Dec. 29, the last Sunday for this year, there will be women's boxing competitions at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium.
					
					 An official of the Ministry of Physical Culture and Sports told KCNA that it has been decided to make it a rule to organize sports games in each weekend, with an aim of upgrading the techniques of athletes and stirring up sports enthusiasm among the local people.
					
					 The step will be helpful to speeding up the building of a sports power, he added.

articles.title: Chemical Construction Complex 40 years Old
articles.content:
Chemical Construction Complex 40 years Old
 Sunchon, December 21 (KCNA) -- The 40th anniversary of the establishment of the Chemical Construction Complex was marked in the DPRK.
					 It was established on Dec. 21, Juche 62(1973).
					
					 It has developed into a reliable construction unit of the nation having a strong construction force and a solid material and technical foundation under the wise leadership of the party and leader.
					
					 It completed the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, the Sungri Chemical Complex, the Ponghwa Chemical Factory and other large chemical industrial bases and dozens of construction projects.
					
					 A meeting took place on Saturday to observe the anniversary.
					
					 Present there were Kwak Pom Gi, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Tong Jong Ho, minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industry, and officials concerned and employees of the complex.
					
					 A congratulatory letter sent by the Central Committee of the WPK to the workers, technicians and officials of the complex was read out at the meeting.
					
					 It highly appreciated the great achievements made by them in their efforts to implement the capital construction policy of the party.

articles.title: News Analyst on S. Korean Military's Confrontational Moves
articles.content:
News Analyst on S. Korean Military's Confrontational Moves
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The puppet military of south Korea has recently kicked off a campaign for putting a ban on more than 50 songs, including the traditional song of the nation "Arirang", in army units after branding them as "seditious".
					 The "Defense Ministry" ordered each unit to delete those songs from medium, banning their introduction into barracks. Consequently, in units and at their karaoke rooms one can see only notice "Banned" if any of those songs was selected.
					
					 In this regard, Minister Kim Kwan Jin and other brasshats of the puppet ministry told the "National Assembly" Legislation and Judiciary Committee that the step was taken for maintaining "military discipline".
					
					"Arirang" is a famous song popular among the Koreans both in the north and south from long ago. Included in those "seditious songs" are folk songs "The Nodul Riverside", "Platycodon", "Milyang Arirang" and "Ballad of the Pheasant" and "Balsam", a song of the enlightenment period, as well as songs created and already spread in the north and the south of Korea.
					
					 Some of the folk songs were designated as "seditious ones" because they were arranged in the north.
					
					  Such action is now arousing strong protests and criticism from among the people of different social standings in south Korea.
					
					 Articles and comments have been posted on different websites one after another to accuse the south Korean puppet military group of having deprived the people of the right to sing even a song at will. One of the articles deplored that it is not free for anyone in south Korea to read a book or sing a song, recalling that the year of 2008 witnessed the list of "seditious books".
					
					 A journalist said that "Arirang" is a song liked by the Koreans through generations and he could not understand why it was branded as a "seditious song". Meanwhile, a publicist queried that any piece of music should be "seditious", if it is sung by a singer in the north.
					
					 The south Korean public has denounced the measure as a reminder of the era of "yusin" fascist dictatorship, which had ruthlessly trampled upon the people's freedom.
					
					 The authorities of south Korea, not content with barring the people from singing the songs reflecting the desire of all Koreans for national reunification, went the length of defiling the nation's cultural heritages only for confrontation among the fellow countrymen.
					
					 Such disgusting step is a separatist and fascist act that could be done only by those steeped in conception of antagonism toward the fellow countrymen. 
					
					 The puppet conservative group should keep in mind that only shameless self-destruction awaits them.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Authorities' Sycophancy toward US
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Authorities' Sycophancy toward US
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The puppet chief executive of south Korea, when recently meeting with the U.S. vice-president on a tour of it,  begged for closer cooperation for the denuclearization of the north, blustering that alliance with the U.S. is a core axis of stability and peace and it is developing in depth. The puppet prime minister of south Korea also cried out for all-inclusive strategic alliance in the 21st century and close cooperation. The puppet group announced a "proposal for expanding the air defense identification zone" with the U.S. approval.
					 Minju Joson Saturday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					  The south Korea-U.S. "alliance" is not a core axis of stability and peace as touted by the puppet group but a shackling and country-selling alliance for helping the U.S. carry out its policy of domination and interference in south Korea and aggression.
					
					 The puppet group is becoming vociferous about development and all-inclusive strategic alliance in the 21st century, far from scrapping the south Korea-U.S. "alliance". This is aimed to reduce south Korea into a U.S. colony and, at the same time, boost cooperation with its U.S. master under the pretext of the nuclear issue and do harm to the DPRK.
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by the fact that the puppet group begged its U.S. master for close cooperation in its moves for 
					
					"denuclearizing the north."
					
					 The group's announcement of the above-said proposal with the U.S. approval is a revelation of its sycophancy toward the U.S. The U.S. approval is designed to use the group as a stooge for carrying out its strategy for dominating Asia.
					
					 Only a disgraceful defeat and self-destruction await the group depending on foreign forces and escalating confrontation, clinging to the coattail of its American master.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Apology for Its Past Sexual Slavery Crime
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Apology for Its Past Sexual Slavery Crime
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held the 1105th Wednesday rally on Dec. 18 outside the building of the Japanese embassy in Seoul demanding the settlement of the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 A statement was read out at the meeting.
					
					 It is more than 20 years since actions have started in demand of Japan's apology and reparation for the sexual slavery crime outside the building of the Japanese embassy in Seoul, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 Although documents proving the coercive nature of Japan's past sexual slavery crime have been opened to public, the government of Japan is still denying the fact of forcible drafting for sexual slavery and distorting its history of aggression.
					
					 Recently the Japanese government is gradually neutralizing the pacifist constitution and crying out for reviving militarism, saying it would "exercise the right to collective self-defense" and "introduce forces for preemptive attack".
					
					 The statement urged Japan to stop at once its moves for emerging a military power harassing peace and stability in Northeast Asia and make an official apology and legal reparation for its past sexual slavery crime.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Searches House of Opposition Party Member
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Searches House of Opposition Party Member
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group is intensifying suppression of a progressive political party.
					 The security investigation group of the puppet Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency searched the house of the chairman of the Tobong District Committee of the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) on Thursday.
					
					 The police committed such violence on charges of the violation of the ill-famed "Security Law", claiming that he sympathized with and praised the idea of the north while working at the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, the Seoul Solidarity for People's Right and others from 2008 and 2011.
					
					 On the same day the Seoul City Committee of the UPP said that he never worked at the above-said organizations, terming the police's violent act an investigation and suppression under the pretext of security in retaliation for the candle-right rally held by the UPP in Tobong District, Seoul in denunciation of the power organs' election rigging.

articles.title: Mammoth Candlelight Rally Held in Seoul
articles.content:
Mammoth Candlelight Rally Held in Seoul
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- People from all walks of life in south Korea held a candlelight rally in Seoul Plaza Thursday on the lapse of one year since the fraudulent election staged by puppet regime with government power involved.
					 Attending it were labor movement organizations now on an all-out strike in protest against the regime's privatization of railway service, civic and social organizations, religionists, lawmakers from opposition parties, students of high schools and others, more than 30,000 in all.
					
					 Speakers there accused the present chief executive of working hard to privatize the railway service and even the field of health care after seizing power through election rigging.
					
					 People from all walks of life are urging Park Geun Hye to step down, declaring they do not need such chief executive as Park, they noted, adding:
					
					 There will be neither happiness of the people nor peace unless Park is forced to step down.
					
					 Candlelight actions will go on till the truth behind the illegal election is probed and those who masterminded it punished.
					
					 Noting they will check the regime's privatization and positively cope with the deterioration of the people's living and suppression of the labor movement, they called on all people to turn out in actions, giving vent to their pent-up resentment at the suppression by power and capital.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Vow to Continue Waging Anti-"government" Struggle
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Vow to Continue Waging Anti-"government" Struggle
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- At least 30 students', civic and social organizations of south Korea held a press conference at Seoul Plaza Thursday on the lapse of one year since the puppet group's fraudulent election, at which they expressed their stand to continue waging the anti-"government" struggle.
					 At the press conference speakers recalled that a wall paper supporting the strike of the Railway Trade Union was pasted at Korea University. People from all walks of life are expressing the antipathy against the authorities, they said, and went on:
					
					 This voice will become louder no mater how the authorities are making desperate efforts to block it.
					
					 They said that they would continue protesting against the ruler and politicians.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Demand Payment of Subsidies to Korean Schools
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Demand Payment of Subsidies to Korean Schools
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The Yamaguchi Prefectural Measure Committee for Subsidies held a meeting at the building of the prefectural assembly on December 11 in protest against the Japanese government's suspension of payment of subsidies to the Korean schools.
					 Present there were Koreans in Yamaguchi Prefecture, members of the prefectural assembly and representatives of 20 organizations.
					
					 A video "Let's protect our school-action in Yamaguchi" was shown at the meeting.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting recalled that this year Koreans in Japan including parents of students and Japanese people have staged actions in protest against the Yamaguchi prefectural office's suspension of payment of subsidies to Korean schools.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 It is a struggle for preserving a bright future of the generations to protect national education. The younger generation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan will struggle to the end just as the Koreans of the first and second generations have protected their schools through struggles.
					
					 They called on the Koreans in Japan and Japanese people to struggle in unity against the national discrimination policy and human rights abuses of the Japanese government and prefectural authorities.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: Portraits of Smiling Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Displayed at School in Mali
articles.content:
Portraits of Smiling Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Displayed at School in Mali
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- An event took place at Kim Jong Il Class of Progres School in Mali on December 17 to display the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The portraits were displayed amid enthusiastic applause of the participants.
					
					 The principal of the school in a speech said that it is a great honor and pride of the whole teaching staff and students to display the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, great leaders of the Korean people and close friends of the Malian people, in the school.
					
					 The principal expressed the will to make positive efforts to take good care of the portraits of the peerlessly great men and develop the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries as desired by them.

articles.title: Floral Baskets, Bouquet Sent to DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
Floral Baskets, Bouquet Sent to DPRK Missions Abroad
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign political party, institutions and personages sent floral baskets and a bouquet to the DPRK missions in the relevant countries on Dec. 16 and 17 on the occasion of the second anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Floral baskets from the China Hong Kong Zhonghwa Energy Fund Commission, the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, the general director of a company of Myanmar and the chairman of the International Commerce Promotion Center were laid before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The president of the Socialist Party of Benin sent a bouquet to the DPRK embassy in Cotonou.

articles.title: Foreign Personages Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Visit DPRK Missions
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries and international organs visited DPRK missions in relevant countries between December 3 and 17 on the occasion of the second anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and their full-length pictures and made bows. 
					
					 They included the director general of China Hong Kong Fire Investment Co. Ltd., the general director of Golden Trip Travel Service Co. Ltd., Hong Kong, the general manager of Emperor Group of Hong Kong, the director general of Metropolis Resources Co. Ltd., and members of the Hong Kong-Green Leaves Shipping Co. Ltd., the Asia Foundation and other companies, the director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, the general director of the Diamond Love Princess Co. Ltd. and his family, the chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association who is a member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria, the chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and chiefs of the organizations under it, teachers and students of Abuja University, the deputy editor of the Radio Editorial Board of the Uzbekistan State TV and Radio Broadcasting Company, the director of Oriat Radio Broadcasting Company, members of the Uzbekistan-DPRK Frie
					
					 ndship Forum and the co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The Romanian newspaper Romania Muncitoare carried a detailed gist of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" on December 16.
					 The work, made public on November 1, Juche 83 (1994), clarifies the idea that Korean style socialism based on the Juche-oriented theory of socialism is most scientific and vital.
					
					 It clearly indicates the principled issues arising in defending socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in UK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in UK
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- A joint remembrance meeting took place in London on Dec. 14 on the occasion of the second anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed in the venue of the meeting were works of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and DPRK publications.
					
					 Present at the meeting were personages of progressive political parties and organizations including the committee for remembering Kim Jong Il, New Communist Party, Revolutionary Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the Coordinating Committee of the British Friends of the DPRK and masses.
					
					 Its participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party, praised Kim Jong Il as a peerless patriot and great revolutionary who dedicated all his life to the prosperity of the country and its people's happiness.
					
					 Michael Chant, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), said that Kim Jong Il found a perfect solution to the issue of succession to the revolutionary cause.
					
					 The sacred revolutionary career and exploits he performed by dedicating all his life to the people, sharing destiny with them, will always be remembered by humankind, Michael noted.
					
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the Association for the Study of Songun Policy, expressed conviction that the socialist cause of Juche would always triumph under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Figures of Pakistan and Syria issued statements on December 14 and 15 on the occasion of the 2nd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Ghulam Rabbani, chairman of the Karachi Juche Study Center of Pakistan, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il made energetic efforts for prosperity and reunification of Korea, happiness of the people and global independence.
					
					 He passed away at a time when a new historic turning point was brought about in the building of a prosperous socialist nation and the Korean revolution. This was a great loss to the Workers' Party of Korea and revolution and deep sorrow to the Korean people and progressive mankind.
					
					 The whole life of Kim Jong Il was, indeed, a brilliant one devoted to building an ideal socialist society in the DPRK and the paradise of people.
					
					 His exploits will shine forever.
					
					 Saber Ballul, head of a department of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus, said:
					
					 When December comes, the adherents of the Juche idea and the world revolutionaries are joining the Korean people in remembering Kim Jong Il in humble reverence.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was a great revolutionary and guardian of socialism who devoted all his life to the accomplishment of the socialist cause and the human cause of independence.
					
					 The Korean people brought about epoch-making changes in building a thriving socialist nation under his outstanding leadership.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's exploits will always be remembered by the Korean people and progressive mankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings, seminars, book and photo exhibitions and film shows took place in Cambodia, India, Iran and Egypt between December 7 and 14 on the occasion of the 2nd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed in the venues of events were photos documenting exploits of Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were works of the peerlessly great men and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Present there were personages of all social standings and masses of relevant countries, those of international and regional bodies.
					
					 Present on invitation were staff members of the DPRK embassies in the relevant countries.
					
					 Participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The secretary general of the Funcinpec Party of Cambodia said that Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul to carry out the cause of reunification of Korea, adding that his devoted efforts would surely yield fruits.
					
					 Speakers including a secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India praised Kim Jong Il for performing feats for the sacred cause for the country and revolution and global independence.
					
					 The manager of the Iran-Korea Friendship Magsal Agro-Stock Farm praised Km Jong Il as an outstanding statesman who performed undying feats for the Korean revolution and the global cause of independence.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in India.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad 
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place in Britain, Nepal and Egypt on Dec. 14 and 15 on the occasion of the second anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On display in the venues of meetings were photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and the respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and books introducing Songun Korea were also on show.
					
					 Present there were personages of various circles and masses in those countries.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Harpal Brar, chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), said Kim Jong Il was a great man who greatly contributed to ensuring peace and security of the world by turning the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state and thwarting the imperialists' nuclear threat.
					
					  C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), and other speakers praised Kim Jong Il as the most prominent leader who successfully led the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence for a long time.
					
					 Kim Jong Il resolutely foiled the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK by holding high the banner of Songun and brought about a turning phase for the country's reunification.
					
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt, lauded Kim Jong Il, a peerlessly great man, for his sacred life dedicated to the happiness of people.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the remembrance meeting in Nepal.

articles.title: Foreign Media Commemorate Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Foreign Media Commemorate Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups from December 1 to 16 to commemorate the second anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The Zimbabwean newspaper Herald carried the following article illustrated with the portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung and photos documenting the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un:
					
					 December 17 marks the second anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il, great father of the Korean people. 
					
					 Despite the great loss to the nation the Korean people turned out as one with the steadfast faith and sense of moral obligation to uphold Kim Jong Il forever and glorify his exploits down through generations under the guidance of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Nothing in the world can block the party, army and people of the DPRK advancing under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The Ugandan paper Sun Rise carried several articles including "Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il who Took Warm Care of All People" with a portrait of his smiling image. 
					
					 The Bulgarian paper Novo Rabotnichesko Delo carried an article together with the photo of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un. It said that the DPRK could firmly defend socialism thanks to the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks of Russia and its Siberia and Far East Bureau posted on their internet websites articles praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il together with his photo.

articles.title: Books Praising Great Men of Mt. Paektu Published in Guinea
articles.content:
Books Praising Great Men of Mt. Paektu Published in Guinea
 Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- A collection of poems "Following Footstep of Songun" and book "Sun and Grain" praising the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu were published in Guinea on December 16. 
					 The collection of poem written by Abdoulaye Diallo, director of Foreign Affairs of the Ministry of Cultural Heritage of Guinea and chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, carried a photo of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together and a photo documenting the revolutionary activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It has three chapters with 67 poems. 
					
					 Chapter 1 "Kim Il Sung, Distinguished Great Man of 20th Century" praised the outstanding disposition and noble traits of the President and undying exploits he performed for the cause of global independence, dealing with the pride and self-esteem of the author as the Juche idea follower. 
					
					 Chapter 2 "Great Sun Lightening 21st Century" highly lauded Kim Jong Il as the sun of the 21st century and the beacon of hope for mankind as he firmly defended and glorified socialism of Juche, shattering all the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK with gifted wisdom, outstanding commanding art and Songun politics. 
					
					 Chapter 3 "Following Footstep of Songun" highly praised Kim Jong Un as the most prominent leader in the present time as he is enjoying deep reverence from the Korean people and the progressives. No force on earth can block the service personnel and people of the DPRK dynamically advancing toward a final victory, united close around him, it added. 
					
					 The book written by Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, carried a photo documenting energetic external activities of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The book consists of "Chapter 1 To Cope with Food Crisis and Agricultural Crisis", "Chapter 2 By Opening New Era of Scientific Farming", "Chapter 3 Meeting with Delegations of Different Countries of Africa" and "Chapter 4 Visiting Bosom of Eternal Sun". 
					
					 It gave a detailed account of the fact that Kim Il Sung worked heart and soul to solve the food problem for the people of African countries including Guinea.

articles.title: Exposicion de bellas artes y artesania dedicada al dia de natalicio de Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Exposicion de bellas artes y artesania dedicada al dia de natalicio de Kim Jong Suk
Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 96o aniversario de natalicio de Kim Jong Suk, Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa, quedo inaugurada la vispera en la Casa Internacional de Cultura de Pyongyang la exposicion nacional de pinturas paisajistas, bordados y productos artesanales.
					En la parte central de la sede se exhibe una pintura de Kim Jong Suk cumpliendo la mision de escolta para la seguridad personal del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung en el periodo de construccion de nueva patria, como lo hizo durante la lucha armada antijaponesa.
					
					Salta a la vista la pintura al oleo "Diciendo que vino para encontrarse con los entranables soldados" en que aparece la imagen del Generalisimo Kim Jong Il quien estuvo siempre con los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Se exhibieron en la ocasion mas de 170 pinturas al estilo coreano, las al oleo, bordados y productos artesanales presentados por los creadores de bellas artes de todo el pais.
					
					La pintura al oleo "Pico Jong Il observado desde la colina Saja" y la otra al estilo coreano "Pino del lago Samil" hacen recordar la noble vida revolucionaria y las hazanas de Kim Jong Suk quien apoyo con mas fidelidad al Presidente Kim Il Sung y aseguro el futuro maravilloso de la Corea del Songun.
					
					Se ven ademas la pintura al estilo coreano "Noche de felicidad" y otras piezas que reflejan la realidad agitada de Corea donde se llevan a la realidad los deseos de los Generalisimos bajo la guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Fueron exhibidos las piezas ceramicas como la porcelana de verdeceledon de Coryo y otros elaborados de piedra que tienen larga historia y tradicion.
					
					La exposicion fue visitada por los funcionarios de la rama de cultura y arte, los creadores de bellas artes, los aficionados, los trabajadores capitalinos y los universitarios.

articles.title: Producida nueva pelicula en RPDC
articles.content:
Producida nueva pelicula en RPDC
Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Los Estudios Cinematograficos 25 de Abril de Corea produjeron nueva pelicula de ficcion "Casa pequena en linea avanzada".
					El film muestra en que esta arraigado el amor de los comandantes del ejercito revolucionario por los soldados mediante la descripcion de un doctor militar que hace todo lo posible por los militares de la linea avanzada.
					
					El protagonista Ryom Min, quien trabaja durante largo tiempo como jefe del cuerpo de asistencia medica de la linea avanzada en acato al noble proposito del Dirigente Kim Jong Il,  entrega su trabajo a Thae Ung, quien vino a este cuerpo despues de graduarse de la universidad.
					
					Ryom le entrega con responsabilidad su trabajo deseando que Thae Ung, quien piensa primero en su honor, sea un buen doctor para los soldados.
					
					Thae Ung recibe gran impresion al ver al protagonista quien trata con fraternidad a los militares y hace que los oficiales se percaten del alma afligida de los soldados.
					
					Escuchando la razon por la cual el comenzo a trabajar en el cuerpo de asistencia, Thae Ung siente profundamente que la devocion por los soldados debe ser basada en la gran camaraderia del Dirigente como lo hizo el protagonista.
					
					Sobre todo, le impresiona mucho el espiritu de sacrificio del protagonista quien en el ultimo dia de su trabajo pasa sin vacilacion por la zona de minas en aras de realizar las operaciones urgentes de un paciente.
					
					La descripcion de los doctores militares que encarnan la concepcion de soldados del Dirigente muestra con emocion que el cuerpo de tratamiento medico en el puesto avanzado es la casa grande que permite llegar el amor del Dirigente a los soldados.

articles.title: ACNC critica a los maniacos de confrontacion del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ACNC critica a los maniacos de confrontacion del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En estos dias, los compinches de la capa militar del Sur de Corea arman alborotos calificando de  peligrosas y prohibiendo cantar mas de 50 canciones inclusive "Arirang", cancion folklorica tradicional de nuestra nacion. 
					El Ministerio de Defensa Nacional ordeno prohibir cantar estas canciones en los cuarteles  y revisar y tacharlas por unidades. 
					
					Ya en las unidades militares y clubes de cantos no se puede buscar esas piezas sino aparecen las letras "cancion prohibida". 
					
					Al respecto, Kim Kwan Jin y otros compinches de la misma cartera dicen en la reunion plenaria del comite de legislacion y justicia de la "Asamblea Nacional" y otras ocasiones que esto es una medida para "mantener la disciplina y orden en el ejercito" y que aquellas canciones son inconvenientes al ambiente. 
					
					Entonces, ?por que ellos arman tales alborotos?
					
					Entre las "canciones peligrosas" figuran "Arirang" y otras creadas y divulgadas ampliamente  en el Norte o en el Sur de Corea, asi como "Nodulgangbyon", "Campanula" "Milyang Arirang", "Tharyong del cazador de faisanas" y otras canciones folcloricas y las de la ilustracion. 
					
					Tambien hay algunas canciones folcloricas fijadas como "canciones perturbadoras" porque fueron "descritas por el Norte de Corea".
					
					Al informarse de esta noticia, en la sociedad surcoreana se alzan las voces de denuncia.
					
					Se publican sucesivamente en las paginas web surcoreanas los articulos de criticas y burlas a los compinches de la capa militar. 
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos expresan la indignacion diciendo que resucito la epoca de la dictadura fascista militar de "Yusin" en que se reprimian hasta los suenos libres de los seres humanos. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos impidieron en el pasado la divulgacion de canciones pro-reunificacion que reflejan la aspiracion de la nacion, y hoy insultan hasta los valiosos patrimonios culturales nacionales. 
					
					El presente caso es la farsa fascista y separatista que pueden cometer solo los maniacos de confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					Toda la nacion coreana repudia a los conservadores surcoreanos, horda de perturbadores.

articles.title: Minju Joson critica acto vendepatria proyanqui de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Minju Joson critica acto vendepatria proyanqui de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En el reciente encuentro con el vicepresidente norteamericano que visito el Sur de Corea, la gobernante titere del Sur de Corea le suplico el "fortalecimiento de la cooperacion para la desnuclearizacion del Norte (de Corea)" diciendo que la "alianza" con EE.UU. es "eje de estabilidad y paz" y "hay que profundizarla y desarrollarla".
					El premier surcoreano abogo tambien por la supuesta "alianza estrategica global del tipo del siglo 21" y la "cooperacion perfecta".
					
					Por otra parte, la camarilla titere surcoreana publico el llamado "proyecto de ampliacion de la zona de discriminacion de defensa aerea" bajo la autorizacion de EE.UU.
					
					El periodico Minju Joson, en un comentario individual difundido este sabado, senala que la "alianza" Sur de Corea-EE.UU. no es el "eje de estabilidad y paz" sino es una herramienta que facilita la dominacion y la intervencion de EE.UU. en el Sur de Corea y el cumplimiento de su politica agresiva, y continua:
					
					En lugar de cancelar la alianza, la banda surcoreana pretende "profundizarla y desarrollarla" describiendola como la "estrategica global del tipo del siglo 21", lo cual parte del malsano proposito de convertir el territorio surcoreano en la peor colonia del imperio y atacar a la RPDC fortaleciendo la cooperacion con su amo norteamericano bajo el pretexto del problema nuclear.
					
					Una prueba contundente de ello es que ella suplico a su amo la "perfecta cooperacion" para la "desnuclearizacion del Norte".
					
					EE.UU. aprobo el "proyecto de ampliacion de la zona de discriminacion de defensa aerea" del Sur de Corea para usarlo como ejecutor de su estrategia de dominar a Asia.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos enfrascados en la campana de enfrentamiento fratricida estan condenados a la derrota aplastante y arruinamiento.
